course.title: Special Topics in Condensed Matter Physics. Topological States of Matter
course.description: Notions of topology have been invoked to clarify the properties of a variety of quantum systems and to classify the possible ground states of such systems. We shall explore in depth examples such as two-dimensional quantized Hall states, and topological insulators in two and three dimensions. Discussions will include effects of disorder and localization phenomena, and practical issues of measurement that may have only marginal relation to topological concepts.
course.prerequisites: Physics 251b, Applied Physics 295a and Physics 262, or equivalents.
